phrases.literal_english: how is life going with you

formal_msa.literal: how is the state of life with you

saudi.literal: I don't have anything to do

formal_msa.literal: I don't have what to do

phrases.literal_english: I want to talk with you

lebanese.literal: I want to talk with you

syrian.literal: I want to talk with you

emirati.literal: I want to talk with you

saudi.literal: I want to talk with you

formal_msa.literal: I want to speak with you

phrases.cultural_notes: Note different intensifiers: bezzaf (Morocco), ktir (Levant), wayed (Gulf)
Very informal, used among close friends/family about loved ones
Religious expression of gratitude after meals is universal
Note future markers: ghadi (Morocco), rah (Levant), ba- (Gulf)
Morocco uses French 'message', others use Arabic 'risala'
